text: Im trying to rename some files in a directory using python.
I've looked around the forums here, and because i'm a noob, I cant adapt what I need from what is out there.
Say I have a file called CHEESE_CHEESE_TYPE.
*** and want to remove "Cheese_" so my resulting filename would be "CHEESE_TYPE"
Im trying to use the os.path.split but it's not working properly.
I have also considered using string manipulations, but have not been successful with that either.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.
